p: Mat1a, S-adenosylhomocysteine hydrolase ( Sahh), and betaine-homocysteine methyltransferase ( Bhmt) expressions were higher in wild-type mice fed with both the CDD and the SPD, than the normal diet. In liver-specific phb1 +/− mice, Mat1a was upregulated in those fed the CDD compared with the normal diet; however, there was no difference in expression was observed in mice fed the SPD and the normal diet. Moreover, in liver-specific phb1 +/− mice, expression of Gnmt, Sahh, Bhmt, and methionine synthase ( Ms) showed a tendency for downregulation following consumption of the SPD compared with the CDD.
